title: Mauricio Pochettino 'planning Tottenham clearout' after poor start to season
text:

Mauricio Pochettino is reportedly planning a mid-season clearout at Tottenham with a number of stars set to be listed for transfer in January.

Spurs have made a disappointing start to the season thus far, losing three of their eight Premier League games and collecting just one point from a possible six in Europe.

Their slump was highlighted by a dismal week which saw them thumped by Bayern Munich and lose away at Brighton .

Now Pochettino is set to shake things up at the club in a bid to save their season - and his job.

The Times report that Eric Dier will be among the casualties placed on the transfer list, along with wantaway stars Christian Eriksen and Danny Rose , as well as misfits Serge Aurier and Victor Wanyama.

(Image: CameraSport via Getty Images)

Dier's future at the club has looked increasingly uncertain, and he has seemed to have regressed in recent seasons.

Once a £40m target for Man Utd, the 25-year-old captained England at the end of last year but has been dropped from the most recent squad, as Harry Winks has leapfrogged him in the pecking order for both club and country.

The arrival of Tanguy Ndombele has done little for his chances, and he will now be allowed to leave should Spurs receive a suitable offer.

(Image: Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty I)

They are also hopeful of getting some form of return for Eriksen leaving the club, with the Dane set to depart when his contract expires at the end of the season anyway.

However whether Spurs can drum up any interest in the player remains to be seen, as clubs may wait until Eriksen is available for nothing, and are able to enter pre-contract negotiations from January.

Similarly it may benefit Eriksen to use his free transfer as leverage in contact discussions with potential future employers to drive up his wages and signing-on fee.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Rose has long wanted a fresh start away from Tottenham , and was left out of the club's pre-season tour despite featuring for the first team since.

But with Ben Davies now joined in the squad by youngster Ryan Sessegnon it appears that three's a crowd, and Rose will be moved on.

Meanwhile Aurier and Wanyama were both offered to other clubs in the summer, and neither have a long-term future at Tottenham.
description: The Spurs boss is ready to put a number of his stars up for sale in a bid to address the clubs recent slump
